Articles.Content:
Hello fellow Kerbanauts!

I just joined today and got a full copy of the game, after playing around with the demo for a little bit.

I think this game is very fun, and I am excited to get to know the community more!

I am curious though, is there a reference chart anywhere that tells you what the different parts of the spacecraft do? I only really know how to use the solid fuel thrusters, basic decouplers, and parachute. I have no idea what to do with the 'engines, engine casings, air intakes, etc.' I am pretty new, but I think this will be a good beginning place to learn how to get into and stay in space

Nice to meet you all! and thank you for any advice ;D

Hi stealth_dorf and welcome to the KSP community.

There isn\'t a reference chart as far as I\'m aware but there is a wiki, I\'ll have to track down the link for you, I\'m glad you had no problems donating and with the store download, Squad have been working hard to sort out the problems we have been having with it.

You can probably find a lot of the info you want just by searching the forums, but don\'t feel afraid to ask

Have fun flying.

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Ahh it looks like the Wiki was fixed up yesterday, here\'s the link.

You can find a lot of info there on most if not all the parts

Ah thank you! I just bookmarked the wiki page.

And thank you all for the warm welcome!

Also, I had no problems, everything went very smoothly. I will probably start browsing around the wiki now. I just spent the last hour looking up youtube videos to figure out what is what haha.

I am thinking that once I figure everything out properly, if I have time, I might try to put together a pdf guide for reference and new players (mainly so I do not forget things as I play). If I do that, I will post it up! I think it could be helpful.

I\'m going to browse around the forums for a bit now, and the wiki. Wish me luck on a munar landing!

Good luck stealth_dorf, and new guides and tutorials are always welcome

May your landers bounce but never break.
